IBM i2 Analyze API

Welcome to the IBM(R) i2 Analyze Java API documentation.

This documentation is aimed at developers who are customizing and extending i2 Analyze. It describes the APIs that apply to the platform as whole, the APIs of the Opal and Onyx services, and the API of the Java client for the Analysis Repository.

See: Description

Common Functionality 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.common
Contains classes and interfaces that code throughout i2 Analyze uses.
com.i2group.apollo.common.tracing
Contains an interface that provides utilities for tracing code execution.
com.i2group.apollo.model.schema
Contains enumerations that enable you to identify system-defined item and property types programmatically, and interfaces that provide domain-specific representations of geospatial values.
com.i2group.apollo.service.common
Contains interfaces and classes that all the standard i2 Analyze services use.
com.i2group.tracing
Contains an interface that provides access to log4j tracing functionality.
Opal Services 
Package Description
com.i2group.disco.audit
Contains interfaces for retrieving information about operations performed against the Information Store, and the users who performed them.
com.i2group.disco.audit.spi
Contains a custom extension point relating to the provision of audit logging for operations against the Information Store.
com.i2group.disco.infostore.importer
Contains utility classes that generate well-formed origin and provenance values for use during Information Store and Solr index ingestion.
com.i2group.disco.model
Contains a class that represents an i2 Analyze origin identifier.
com.i2group.disco.user
Contains an implementation of a user groups provider that retrieves the necessary information from WebSphere.
com.i2group.disco.user.spi
Contains custom extension points relating to user group provision, and the per-user allocation of default security dimension values for user-created records.
Onyx Services: General 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.adminservice
The i2 Analyze admin service provides clients with the ability to perform administrative functions on the whole system.
com.i2group.apollo.infoservice
The i2 Analyze info service provides clients with a variety of functionality that is relevant to the whole system.
com.i2group.apollo.itemretrievalservice
The standard i2 Analyze item retrieval service provides clients with the ability to retrieve any version of any stored item, alone or in groups, in a variety of ways.

Calls to methods in this service must include a SOAP header containing an element named <ApolloMetadata> with an attribute named TimeZone. The value of the TimeZone attribute indicates the time zone that the client requires dates and times to be sent and displayed in.
com.i2group.apollo.networksearchservice
The standard i2 Analyze network search service provides clients with the ability to perform network searches of various types against the latest versions of data, and to retrieve scored search results.

Calls to methods in this service must include a SOAP header containing an element named <ApolloMetadata> with an attribute named TimeZone. The value of the TimeZone attribute indicates the time zone that the client requires dates and times to be sent and displayed in.
com.i2group.apollo.searchservice
The standard i2 Analyze search service provides clients with the ability to perform searches of various types against the latest versions of data, and to retrieve scored search results.

Calls to methods in this service must include a SOAP header containing an element named <ApolloMetadata> with an attribute named TimeZone. The value of the TimeZone attribute indicates the time zone that the client requires dates and times to be sent and displayed in.
com.i2group.apollo.searchservice.common.model  
Onyx Services: Analysis Repository 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.alertfeedretrievalservice
The i2 Analyze alert feed retrieval service provides clients with the ability to retrieve alert feeds and determine which ones they are subscribed to.

Calls to methods in this service must include a SOAP header containing an element named <ApolloMetadata> with an attribute named TimeZone. The value of the TimeZone attribute indicates the time zone that the client requires dates and times to be sent and displayed in.
com.i2group.apollo.alertfeedservice
The i2 Analyze alert feed service provides clients with the ability to create, subscribe to, and unsubscribe from alert feeds in the Analysis Repository.
com.i2group.apollo.alertretrievalservice
The i2 Analyze alert retrieval service provides clients with the ability to retrieve the alerts generated by alert feeds.

Calls to methods in this service must include a SOAP header containing an element named <ApolloMetadata> with an attribute named TimeZone. The value of the TimeZone attribute indicates the time zone that the client requires dates and times to be sent and displayed in.
com.i2group.apollo.auditservice
The i2 Analyze audit service provides clients with the ability to retrieve audit information about changes to items in the Analysis Repository.

Calls to methods in this service must include a SOAP header containing an element named <ApolloMetadata> with an attribute named TimeZone. The value of the TimeZone attribute indicates the time zone that the client requires dates and times to be sent and displayed in.
com.i2group.apollo.commandservice
The i2 Analyze command service provides clients with the ability to execute commands that make changes to data, and to manage the leases that help determine which commands a particular client can execute at a given moment in time.
com.i2group.apollo.cqrs
Contains interfaces for interacting with events and users in i2 Analyze.
com.i2group.apollo.indexadminservice
The i2 Analyze index admin service provides clients with the ability to take a snapshot of the search index that can be backed up without being affected by simultaneous changes being made to the index.
com.i2group.apollo.itemhistoryservice
The standard i2 Analyze item history service provides clients with the ability to look at the changes that items have undergone as a result of edit and merge operations. The service also enables clients to examine the differences between two versions of an item.

Calls to methods in this service must include a SOAP header containing an element named <ApolloMetadata> with an attribute named TimeZone. The value of the TimeZone attribute indicates the time zone that the client requires dates and times to be sent and displayed in.
com.i2group.apollo.purgeservice
The i2 Analyze purge service provides clients with the ability to remove all trace of items and sets from the Analysis Repository.
Onyx Services: External Data 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata
Contains a supplied implementation of an external data subset locator that creates the subset to which it also provides access.
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.adapter
Contains an interface whose methods can be called by an external data subset creation service or an external data subset locator to retrieve data from an external data source.
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.connector
Contains interfaces for locating, retrieving, and modifying the contents of an external data subset before the items in the subset are returned to clients.
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.delpsservice
The i2 Analyze DELPS service provides clients with the ability to interact with data load ELP stage solutions.
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.documentstore
Contains functionality for downloading files from external data sources.
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.edrs
Contains classes and interfaces for retrieving data directly from an external data source in a Data Acquisition project.
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.loader
Contains classes and interfaces for creating and managing items from an external data source in the Analysis Repository.
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.retrievalservice
An i2 Analyze external data retrieval service provides clients with the ability to retrieve live information from an external data provider that has already been the subject of data acquisition.
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.subsetcreationservice
An i2 Analyze external data subset creation service provides users with the ability to perform search and expand operations against an appropriately configured external data provider through the Intelligence Portal user interface.
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.subsetexplorationservice
An i2 Analyze external data subset exploration service provides clients with the ability to retrieve information from a subset of data that has been created from an external data provider.
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.typeconversion
Contains classes that allow code in a Data Acquisition project to make changes to data that has been retrieved from an external data source.
Onyx Services: Extension Points 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.alertingapi
Contains a custom extension point relating to alerting.
com.i2group.apollo.itemstoreapi
Contains interfaces for simple interactions with events and the item store from server-side code.
com.i2group.apollo.security
Contains supplied implementations of providers that help to determine what access levels different users have to different data.
com.i2group.apollo.securityapi
Contains custom extension points relating to security.
com.i2group.apollo.service.loggingapi
Contains custom extension points relating to logging.
com.i2group.apollo.useractivitylogger
Contains a supplied implementation of a user activity logger that performs no logging.
Onyx Data Transport: General 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.infoservice.transport
Contains classes for the service that provides system-wide information for i2 Analyze.
com.i2group.apollo.model.builders
Contains interfaces for creating builders for creating objects of various types to be used in i2 Analyze.
com.i2group.apollo.model.builders.propertyvalue
Contains builders for creating property values of generic types to be used as item data in i2 Analyze.
com.i2group.apollo.model.builders.propertyvalue.typed
Contains builders for creating property values of specific types to be used as item data in i2 Analyze.
com.i2group.apollo.model.data.transport
Contains classes and interfaces for communicating data with i2 Analyze services that interact with the Analysis Repository.
com.i2group.apollo.model.data.transport.factory
Contains factory classes for creating item data, for use in commands that are issued to the i2 Analyze command service.
com.i2group.apollo.model.schema.transport
Contains classes for communicating schema information with i2 Analyze services that interact with the Analysis Repository.
com.i2group.apollo.model.schema.transport.unchecked
Contains a class for communicating unchecked data with i2 Analyze services.
com.i2group.apollo.model.security.dynamic.transport
Contains classes for communicating information about the contents of a dynamic security schema to other parts of an i2 Analyze deployment.
com.i2group.apollo.model.security.transport
Contains classes for communicating security information with i2 Analyze services.
com.i2group.apollo.networksearchservice.transport
Contains classes for the services that perform network searches for items in the Analysis Repository and external data sources.
com.i2group.apollo.searchservice.transport
Contains classes for the services that search for items in the Analysis Repository and external data sources.
Onyx Data Transport: Analysis Repository 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.adminservice.transport
Contains classes for communicating information with the service that administers a deployment of i2 Analyze.
com.i2group.apollo.alertfeedretrievalservice.transport
Contains classes for the service that retrieves alert feeds from the Analysis Repository.
com.i2group.apollo.alertfeedservice.transport
Contains classes for the service that creates alert feeds in the Analysis Repository.
com.i2group.apollo.alertretrievalservice.transport
Contains classes for the service that retrieves alerts about items in the Analysis Repository.
com.i2group.apollo.auditservice.transport
Contains classes for the service that retrieves audit entries about items in the Analysis Repository.
com.i2group.apollo.commandservice.transport
Contains classes and interfaces for commands that make changes to data in the Analysis Repository.
com.i2group.apollo.commandservice.transport.factory
Contains factory classes for creating commands that are issued to the i2 Analyze command service.
com.i2group.apollo.events.transport
Contains classes for the events that commands can fire, as well as classes and interfaces that define changes to the Analysis Repository.
com.i2group.apollo.events.transport.factory
Contains factory classes for creating change information, for use in commands that are issued to the i2 Analyze command service.
com.i2group.apollo.itemhistoryservice.transport
Contains classes for the service that reports on changes to items in the Analysis Repository.
com.i2group.apollo.model.provenance.transport
Contains classes for communicating provenance information with i2 Analyze services.
Onyx Data Transport: External Data 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.transport
Contains classes for communicating information between the services that are responsible for data access on-demand solutions in i2 Analyze.
Analysis Repository File Storage 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.documentstore
Contains functionality for downloading files from, and uploading files to, the i2 Analyze document store.
Analysis Repository Java Client 
Package Description
com.i2group.apollo.client
Contains interfaces and a class for interacting with i2 Analyze through the supplied Java client.
com.i2group.apollo.client.handlers
Contains classes and interfaces that provide access to information that is communicated between the supplied Java client and i2 Analyze.

Welcome to the IBM(R) i2 Analyze Java API documentation.

This documentation is aimed at developers who are customizing and extending i2 Analyze. It describes the APIs that apply to the platform as whole, the APIs of the Opal and Onyx services, and the API of the Java client for the Analysis Repository.

Opal services

The packages in the API for the Opal services cover three broad areas of interaction with the Information Store. You can use them to change how the Opal services determine users' group membership, to enable auditing of user operations, and to assist with the process of loading data into the store.

Onyx services

Many of the packages in the API for the Onyx services apply to the Analysis Repository, and demonstrate command and query responsibility segregation (CQRS). An Onyx service can modify (write) or query (read) data in the Analysis Repository, but never both. The design has a number of consequences:

•  Responsibility for creating, updating, and deleting data is separated into data-writing services that are independent from the services that read data. The data-writing services communicate changes to the read services using events.

•  The command service, which is a data-writing service, has the following responsibilities:

    •  Validating commands according to i2 Analyze rules

    •  Converting valid commands to i2 Analyze events

    •  Placing events in the event store

•  The event store is an audit trail that contains information about every command and purge request (successfully) issued to i2 Analyze for the Analysis Repository. Each event also records which user issued the request, when they issued it, and where (that is, what IP address) they issued it from.

•  Any read service, new or old, can be started or brought back up to date by replaying the event store.

•  i2 Analyze does not use a single store for all Analysis Repository data. Instead, data-reading services maintain their own data stores that provide optimum performance for their particular needs. Data-reading services populate these data stores in response to the events they receive. They are free to act upon or ignore events as their function requires.
